meanings.sent1: The family's allodial rights allowed them to own the land without any obligations.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained that allodial ownership meant complete freedom from feudal duties.
meanings.sent3: The allodial land was like a kingdom of its own, free from any outside control.
meanings.sent4: Her allodial claim to the property was as solid as the bedrock beneath it.
meanings.sent5: The allodial title was a treasure passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: A type of land ownership free from feudal obligations.
meanings.sent1: The farmer's allodial allowed him to cultivate the land without any restrictions.
meanings.sent2: In the past, allodial ownership was rare and highly valued.
meanings.sent3: The allodial plot seemed to have a magical shield protecting it from taxes.
meanings.sent4: His allodial rights were a shield against any claims from others.
meanings.sent5: The allodial deed was a symbol of independence and autonomy.
